dataAccessTier

Interface DataAccessible

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBUserDataAccessor, FileUserDataAccessor

    public interface DataAccessible
    The DataAccessible interface defines a contract for accessing user data. Any class that implements this interface must provide an implementation for retrieving a User object that contains user-specific information. This interface is designed to allow flexibility in how user data is accessed, whether from a database, a file system, or any other source. Implementing classes are responsible for the specific details of how data is fetched and provided.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User getUserData()
      Retrieves the user data and returns it as a User object.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserData

        User getUserData()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves the user data and returns it as a User object. Implementing classes should handle the logic for fetching user data from the appropriate source (e.g., a database or a file). If there is any issue during data retrieval, this method may throw an exception.
        Returns:
        A User object containing the user's data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs during the data retrieval process.
